item.title: General Synod passes motion to sign, endorse Christian-Muslim dialogue
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
General Synod voted July 15 to sign on to “A Common Word Between Us and You” and endorse it as a model for Christian-Muslim dialogue.

item.title: General Synod approves Journal, communications changes
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
The 42nd General Synod approved changes to the organization of the two committees that have overseen the communications and storytelling efforts of the Anglican Church of Canada, unifying two committees into one and adopting changes related to the mandate, governance and editorial policy of the Anglican Journal.

The post General Synod approves Journal, communications changes appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.title: General Synod approves Jubilee Commission
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
General Synod passed a motion July 16 to affirm the creation of the Jubilee Commission, a commission tasked with finding a “just, sustainable and equitable funding base for the self-determining Indigenous Anglican church.”

The post General Synod approves Jubilee Commission appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.title: General Synod expands full communion recognition
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
General Synod passed a resolution July 15 to recognize full communion among the Anglican Church of Canada (ACC), the U.S.-based Episcopal Church (TEC), the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Canada (ELCIC) and the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA).

The post General Synod expands full communion recognition appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.description:

item.title: Church suffers deficit in 2018, dioceses ‘struggling’ to meet financial commitments, General Synod hears
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
A fall in revenues, especially contributions from the dioceses, combined with increased expenses to put the Anglican Church of Canada in a deficit position in 2018, General Synod heard Monday, July 15.

The post Church suffers deficit in 2018, dioceses ‘struggling’ to meet financial commitments, General Synod hears appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.title: Prayer for reconciliation with the Jews passes first reading at General Synod
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
An effort to remove a prayer for conversion of the Jews from the Book of Common Prayer (BCP) and to replace it with one for reconciliation with the Jews has passed its first major hurdle at General Synod.

The post Prayer for reconciliation with the Jews passes first reading at General Synod appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.title: General Synod passes pension plan, CoGS motions
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
General Synod voted July 14 to make changes to the General Synod Pension Plan that would allow groups outside of the Anglican Church of Canada to join the plan. In the same afternoon session, the synod also passed motions to put in place a plan to re-evaluate the purpose and mission of the Council of General Synod (CoGS).

The post General Synod passes pension plan, CoGS motions appeared first on General Synod 2019.
item.content:encoded: The post General Synod passes pension plan, CoGS motions appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.title: Church grapples with pain after marriage canon vote—with new developments possible
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
“Our children are crying.”

That was how Primate Fred Hiltz—paraphrasing the observation of delegate Michael Chartrand—described the pain in the room following the failure of the 42nd General Synod to pass a resolution amending the marriage canon, which would have allowed for the solemnization of same-sex marriage.

The post Church grapples with pain after marriage canon vote—with new developments possible appeared first on General Synod 2019.
item.content:encoded: The post Church grapples with pain after marriage canon vote—with new developments possible appeared first on General Synod 2019.

item.title: General Synod passes justice resolutions, receives apology at July 13 session
item.dc:creator: General Synod Communications / Anglican Journal
item.description:
General Synod of the Anglican Church of Canada passed four resolutions on the evening of July 13, following presentations from Primate’s World Relief and Development Fund (PWRDF), the Anglican Foundation of Canada and the Council of the North. The subject of the previous day’s vote on same-sex marriage also briefly returned to the floor.

The post General Synod passes justice resolutions, receives apology at July 13 session appeared first on General Synod 2019.
